snippet: Curtis Granderson, who will wear No. 3 — Babe Ruth’s number — with the Mets, is a home run hitter, but he also struck out a club-record 195 times in his last full season with the Yankees.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that outfielder Curtis Granderson comes to New York Mets because of his ability to hit home runs, but in his last full season with New York Yankees he set club record for strikeouts; holds story of the modern game is that teams will tolerate strikeouts in order to get hits.
lead_paragraph: Curtis Granderson, who will wear No. 3 — Babe Ruth’s number — with the Mets, is a home run hitter, but he also struck out a club-record 195 times in his last full season with the Yankees.

headline.main: In Granderson, Mets Take Strikeouts With the Power
headline.print_headline: In Granderson, Mets Take Strikeouts With the Power
